intro: Phlomoides puberula, commonly known as the hairy phlomoides, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of small, pale blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Phlomoides puberula is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
